result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis I. KOCH was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

$395.00 balance of fine and costs paid per commitment.
Original commitment returned to Clerk of Court office.
Commitment Payment Notice
Commitment Payment Notice
Letter from Public Works Department indicating defendant has successfully completed 30 hours of community service at DAV Thrift Store in Prescott Arizona as of 05-14-2016.
Commitment Payment Notice
Commitment Payment Notice.

Order for Arrest and Commitment on Failure to pay balance of fine and costs issued.  Defendant to be committed to the county jail until balance of $645.00 has been paid, not to exceed thirteen (13) days consecutive to any other sentence or commitment imposed.
Cover letter and payment plan documents

Stipulation and Order Modifying Sentence.
It is ordered that the sentence of the defendant as previously ordered is modified in its entirety and he is resentenced as follows:
1) the defendant shall pay a fine of $200.00 plus costs for a total of $705.00.  Payment shall be due within 60 days of today's date.  If not paid, the defendant is to serve 15 days county jail for failure to pay;
2) the defendant shall also complete thirty (30) hours of community service within three months of today's date and he shall furnish written verification of the same to his attorney and the Manitowoc County District Attorney's office.
Reminder notice mailed to Attorney Kerscher.
